column3: This isn't really a typo, it's an instruction in the documentation, meant to be interpreted rather than applied literally. IMO it's reasonable either way.
Agree it's not exactly a typo, but let's just drop the dots and remove any ambiguity.\n\nutACK 3c0b328
Tend to NACK this, I think the three dots are fine. THey just specify where the rest of the arguments has to go.
`...` is short and should be obvious for those that use these instructions. Agree with @laanwj.\n\n-0
Closing this - thanks for the contribution, but there isn't pressing reason to change this.
